juzzyPython.examples package

Submodules

juzzyPython.examples.SimpleIT2FLS module

SimpleIT2FLS.py Created 20/1/2022

class juzzyPython.examples.SimpleIT2FLS.SimpleIT2FLS(unit=False)[source]

Bases: object

Class SimpleIT2FLS: A simple example of an interval Type-2 FLS based on the “How much to tip the waiter” scenario. The example is an extension of the Type-1 FLS example where we extend the MFs and use the Interval Type-2 System classes. Note that in contrast to the type-1 case, here only two sets are used to model the service quality. We have two inputs: food quality and service level and as an output we would like to generate the applicable tip.

Parameters:None

Functions:

getTip PlotMFs getControlSurfaceData

getControlSurfaceData(useCentroidDefuzz, input1Discs, input2Discs, unit=False) → None[source]

Get the data to plot the control surface

getTip(foodQuality, serviceLevel) → None[source]

Calculate the output based on the two inputs

plotMFs(name, sets, xAxisRange, discretizationLevel)[source]

Plot the lines for each membership function of the sets

class juzzyPython.examples.SimpleNSIT2_IT2FLS.SimpleNSIT2_IT2FLS(unit=False)[source]

Bases: object

Class SimpleNSIT2_IT2FLS: A simple example of a non singleton Type-1 interval Type-2 FLS based on the “How much to tip the waiter” scenario. The example is an extension of the Type-1 FLS example where we extend the MFs and use the Interval Type-2 System classes. Note that in contrast to the type-1 case, here only two sets are used to model the service quality. We have two inputs: food quality and service level and as an output we would like to generate the applicable tip.

juzzyPython.examples.SimpleT1FLS_twoOutputs module

SimpleT1FLS_twoOutputs.py Created 22/12/2021

class juzzyPython.examples.SimpleT1FLS_twoOutputs.SimpleT1FLS_twoOutputs(unit=False)[source]

Bases: object

Class SimpleT1FLS_twoOutputs: A simple example of a type-1 FLS based on the “How much to tip the waiter” scenario which has been augmented to showcase the use of two outputs. We have two inputs: food quality and service level and as an output we would like to generate the applicable tip as well as a recommended smile as a sign of satisfaction.

Parameters:None

Functions:

juzzyPython.examples.SimplezGT2FLS module

SimplezGT2FLS.py Created 10/2/2022

class juzzyPython.examples.SimplezGT2FLS.SimplezGT2FLS(unit=False)[source]

Bases: object

Class SimplezGT2FLS: A simple example of a zSlices based general Type-2 FLS based on the “How much to tip the waiter” scenario. The example is an extension of the Interval Type-2 FLS example where we extend the MFs and use zSlices based General Type-2 Fuzzy System classes. We have two inputs: food quality and service level and as an output we would like to generate the applicable tip.

Parameters:None

Functions:

getTip PlotMFs getControlSurfaceData

getControlSurfaceData(useCentroidDefuzz, input1Discs, input2Discs, unit=False) → None[source]

Get the data to plot the control surface

getTip(foodQuality, serviceLevel) → None[source]

Calculate the output based on the two inputs

plotMFs(name, sets, xAxisRange, discretizationLevel, plotAsLines, plotAsSurface)[source]

Plot the lines for each membership function of the sets

juzzyPython.examples.SimplezGT2FLSNSGT2 module

SimplezGT2FLSNSGT2.py Created 15/2/2022

class juzzyPython.examples.SimplezGT2FLSNSGT2.SimplezGT2FLSNSGT2(unit=False)[source]

Bases: object

Class SimplezGT2FLSNSGT2: A simple example of a zSlices based general Type-2 FLS based on the “How much to tip the waiter” scenario. The example is an extension of the Interval Type-2 FLS example where we extend the MFs and use zSlices based General Type-2 Fuzzy System classes. It is the same example as SimpleGT2FLS with a non singleton input GT2. We have two inputs: food quality (non singleton) and service level and as an output we would like to generate the applicable tip.

Parameters:None

Functions:

getTip PlotMFs getControlSurfaceData

class juzzyPython.examples.SimplezGT2FLSNSIT2.SimplezGT2FLSNSIT2(unit=False)[source]

Bases: object

Class SimplezGT2FLSNSIT2: A simple example of a zSlices based general Type-2 FLS based on the “How much to tip the waiter” scenario. The example is an extension of the Interval Type-2 FLS example where we extend the MFs and use zSlices based General Type-2 Fuzzy System classes. It is the same example as SimpleGT2FLS with a non singleton input IT2. We have two inputs: food quality (non singleton) and service level and as an output we would like to generate the applicable tip.

Bases: object

Class SimplezGT2FLSNST1: A simple example of a zSlices based general Type-2 FLS based on the “How much to tip the waiter” scenario. The example is an extension of the Interval Type-2 FLS example where we extend the MFs and use zSlices based General Type-2 Fuzzy System classes. It is the same example as SimpleGT2FLS with a non singleton input. We have two inputs: food quality (non singleton) and service level and as an output we would like to generate the applicable tip.

juzzyPython.examples.SimplezGT2FLS_multicore module

SimplezGT2FLS_multicore.py Created 5/3/2022

class juzzyPython.examples.SimplezGT2FLS_multicore.SimplezGT2FLS_multicore(unit=False)[source]

Bases: object

Class SimplezGT2FLS_multicore: A simple example of a zSlices based general Type-2 FLS based on the “How much to tip the waiter” scenario. The example is an extension of the Interval Type-2 FLS example where we extend the MFs and use zSlices based General Type-2 Fuzzy System classes. We have two inputs: food quality and service level and as an output we would like to generate the applicable tip. This uses multicore processing

juzzyPython.examples.SimplezGT2FLS_multicore_twoOutputs module

SimplezGT2FLS_multicore_twoOutputs.py Created 7/3/2022

class juzzyPython.examples.SimplezGT2FLS_multicore_twoOutputs.SimplezGT2FLS_multicore_twoOutputs(unit=False)[source]

Bases: object

Class SimplezGT2FLS_multicore_twoOutputs: A simple example of a zSlices based general Type-2 FLS based on the “How much to tip the waiter” which has been augmented to showcase the use of two outputs. The example is an extension of the Interval Type-2 FLS example where we extend the MFs and use zSlices based General Type-2 Fuzzy System classes. We have two inputs: food quality and service level and as an output we would like to generate the applicable tip as well as a recommended smile as a sign of satisfaction. This uses multicore processing

Parameters:None
